Once in a quaint village, there lived a scruffy dog named Doodle. Unlike any other canine, Doodle had a unique talent: he could draw. One day, while watching children play, he picked up a discarded crayon with his mouth and began sketching in the dirt. The villagers gasped as he created vivid pictures of their daily lives, capturing the beauty of their simple world. Inspired, they provided him with paper and colors. Doodleâ€™s artwork brought joy and unity to the village, transforming him into a beloved local artist. Through his drawings, he reminded everyone that creativity knows no bounds, even for a dog.
